result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua J. Maddix was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Joshua J. Maddix in court with attorney Jessica L Schuster.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called @ 9:31 a.m. Agreement stated - Def will plead to charge, withheld sentence, 2 yrs probation, AODA and follow through, court costs, 45 days jail. Atty Schuster agrees. Asking 60 days to report and 9 days credit if revoked. State agrees. Def agrees. No contest plea. Court reviews plea quest. and constitutional rights. Atty Schuster satisfied/factual basis. Court finds Def understands, accepts plea and finds guilty of manufacture/deliver schedule I, II narcotics. Def makes statement. Court accepts agreement. Sentence withheld, 2 yrs probation, AODA and follow through, costs including DNA surcharge, 45 days jail, report no later than 6 p.m. 11/14/14, huber if employed. 9 days credit if revoked. Def advised of firearms and voting rights.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Postconviction rights. Return bond to poster.

ADDRESS INFO for Joshua J. Maddix
Current: 514 Dorr St., Apt 2, Antigo, WI 54409 United States  (Effective: 07-28-2014)
Prior: 1531 Western Ave, Green Bay, WI 54303

Defendant Joshua J. Maddix in court with attorney Jessica L Schuster.  Ralph M Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing was scheduled for today.  Def will waive.  Court reviews right to preliminary hearing.  Waiver signed by def..  Def waives preliminary.  Court accepts waiver, find probable cause.  Information filed.  Waive reading.  Not guilty plea entered.  Bond will continue  Status conference scheduled for June 30, 2014 at 03:30 pm.
No possession of prescription without a valid prescription.

Defendant Joshua J. Maddix in custody & via-video with attorney Jessica L Schuster in courtroom.  Ralph M Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls @ 1:43 pm. Atty Schsuter has copy of complaint waives reading.  Atty Schuster gives bond argument.   State gives bond argument. Court will modify bond to $350.00 cash bond. Atty Schuster is requesting a p.h.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 4, 2014 at 03:15 pm.
No possession of prescription without valid prescription

Defendant Joshua J. Maddix in court, via video, in custody.  Ralph M Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Warrant vacated and set aside.  Def does not have a copy of complaint.  DA will provide copy.  Court reads charges with possible penalties.  Def advised of right to an atty.  State request cash bond.  Bond set by Court.  At this time def has copy of complaint.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 2, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
